Body: So, I made a mistake. My LG G3 was Android Lollipop and I used a new method to root it (the video is on YouTube, a guy doing it on G Flex 2). Then I wanted to test something with CyanogenMod, so I downloaded TWRP image and flashed it with flashify.The phone died. I got certification boot something and I wasn't able to boot. The only option was download mod. So kmz (or something like this) then I did it and it did a factory reset too.Well, I had 400 pictures in my /DCIM folder, all for my project and they are all gone. I normally would've gotten backups in TWRP and I had no idea installing it would kill my phone.And now I need those photos.I tried many things, specially Dr. Fone, and although I grant the root access for the program, it says there is no root access (after several times of SU saying I granted root for this app).Again, I need those photos. Please help!
Title: Recovering photos after factory reset

history.Text: So, I made a mistake. My LG G3 was lollipop and I used a new method to root it. (the video is on youtube. A guy doing it on G flex 2) Then I wanted to test something at cyanogenmode, so I downloaded TWRP image and flashed it with flashify.The phone died. I got "certification boot something" and I wasn't able to boot. The only option was downlod mod. So kmz (or something like this) then I did it and it did a factory reset too.Well, I had 400 pictures, all for my project and they are all gone. I normally would've gotten backups in twrp and I had no Idea installing it would kill my phone.And Now I need those photos.I tried many things, specially Dr. Fone, and although I grant the root access for the damn program, it says there is no root access (after several times of SU saying I granted root for this daMn app).Again, I need those photos.Please help!

So, I made a mistake. My LG G3 was Android lollipop and I used a new method to root it (the video is on youtube. A guy doing it on G flex 2). Then I wanted to test something at Cyanogenmod, so I downloaded TWRP image and flashed it with **flashify**.The phone died. I got **`certification boot something`** and I wasn't able to boot. The only option was download mod. So kmz (or something like this) then I did it and it did a factory reset too.Well, I had 400 pictures, all for my project and they are all gone. I normally would've gotten backups in TWRP and I had no idea installing it would kill my phone.And now I need those photos.I tried many things, specially **Dr. Fone**, and although I grant the root access for the damn program, it says there is no root access (after several times of SU saying I granted root for this damn app).Again, I need those photos.Please help!

history.Comment: Proposed by 96277 approved by -1 edit id of 11197

history.Text: So, I made a mistake. My LG G3 was Android Lollipop and I used a new method to root it (the video is on YouTube, a guy doing it on G Flex 2). Then I wanted to test something with CyanogenMod, so I downloaded TWRP image and flashed it with **flashify**.The phone died. I got **`certification boot something`** and I wasn't able to boot. The only option was download mod. So kmz (or something like this) then I did it and it did a factory reset too.Well, I had 400 pictures in my `/DCIM` folder, all for my project and they are all gone. I normally would've gotten backups in TWRP and I had no idea installing it would kill my phone.And now I need those photos.I tried many things, specially **Dr. Fone**, and although I grant the root access for the program, it says there is no root access (after several times of SU saying I granted root for this app).Again, I need those photos. Please help!
